intro: Gelasine, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers. The plant has silvery, fuzzy leaves that help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Gelasine thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it a hardy perennial in coastal environments. Its ornamental value has made it a popular choice in gardens and landscaping.
